Ingredients.15: 1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced

Ingredients.24: 1  canned chipotle pepper in adobo, finely chopped

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.

Directions.2: Mix together chili powder, paprika, cumin, onion powder, salt, and pepper for tacos in a small bowl until well combined.

Directions.3: Brush 2 tablespoons oil all over the prepared pan, then add mahi mahi fillets. Drizzle remaining 1 tablespoon oil over the fillets and rub to coat. Sprinkle spice mixture evenly over both sides of the fillets.

Directions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes evenly with a fork and drippings are caramelized, 10 to 12 minutes.

Directions.5: While the fish is baking, prepare slaw by combining coleslaw mix, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, oil, lime juice, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl; toss until well combined.

Directions.6: Stir together sour cream, chipotle in adobo, adobo sauce, and salt for crema together in a small bowl.

Directions.7: Char tortillas over a gas flame.

Directions.8: Remove fish from the oven and flake it with a fork.

Directions.9: Fill tortillas with fish and slaw. Drizzle with crema and squeeze lime wedges over top.
